context_bundle.summary: Apache Kafka distributed streaming platform: Publish-subscribe messaging with topics, partitions, consumer groups. Producers publish records, consumers subscribe to topics. Partitioning for parallelism, replication for fault tolerance. Kafka Streams for processing. Performance: tens of millions events/sec, 10-100ms latency. Use cases: event streaming, log aggregation, metrics, CDC (Change Data Capture). Alternatives: Kinesis (AWS), Pub/Sub (GCP).

onboarding.quick_start: Kafka basics: Topics (categories), Partitions (parallelism), Consumer Groups (load balancing). Producer: producer.send(topic='events', value=message). Consumer: consumer.subscribe(['events']), for message in consumer: process(message.value). Config: bootstrap.servers='localhost:9092', group.id='consumer-group'. Kafka Streams: KStream.filter().map().to('output-topic'). Performance: millions/sec throughput, sub-100ms latency. Replication: factor=3 for HA. Partitions: more partitions = more parallelism. Use for: event streaming, logs, metrics, CDC.
common_patterns: Consumer group: multiple consumers share partitions for load balancing
Partitioning: key-based (same key -> same partition) for ordering
Kafka Connect: connectors for DBs, S3, Elasticsearch (no code ETL)
